definition: to pull/to turn (sth) around/to turn around (a situation)/to recoup

sentences.english: To fire the gun, just pull the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 开枪只需扣一下扳机就可以了。

sentences.english: Their fingers are always on the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 他们的手指总是扣着扳机。

sentences.english: When the trigger is released, auto-start is turned off and throttle operates normally again.
sentences.chinese: 当松开扳机，自动启动关闭，油门回复正常工作状态。

sentences.english: He made his shaking arm steady, then touched the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 他把抖动的手臂稳下来，接着扣下扳机。
士兵们扳起步枪的扳机。

sentences.english: Don't blame us we didn't pull the trigger?
Action components are readily accessible for cleaning via Ruger's tool-free detachable trigger guard system.
sentences.chinese: 活动部件便于清洗，且其扳机护环无须工具即可撤卸。

sentences.english: I pulled the trigger on my mig and beaded a nut down low, and then another and another.
sentences.chinese: 我扣动电焊上的扳机一个又一个地往下焊螺母。

sentences.english: Buck's hand dropped from the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 巴克放下搭住扳机的手。

sentences.english: This gun has a hair trigger .
He kept aiming his gun at me, but didn't squeeze off.
sentences.chinese: 他一直用枪瞄准着我，却没敢扣动扳机。

sentences.english: At the same moment, he pressed the trigger of his rifle. The flame leaped forth.
sentences.chinese: 同时他扳动卡宾枪的扳机，喷出了一道闪光。

sentences.english: Finance is gun; politics is knowing when to pull the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 金融就是枪，政治就是知道什么抠动扳机。

sentences.english: I raised the shotgun and pulled the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 我拿起猎枪，扣动了扳机。

sentences.english: When you squeeze the trigger , a round or rounds of ammunition are fired.
sentences.chinese: 当你扣下扳机，一发或者多发弹药就射出来了。

sentences.english: Learn to identify and avoid your triggers.
sentences.chinese: 学习辨认和避免触发愤怒的扳机。

definition: roof of the mouth/to load (a gun)
to pull out/to pull a lever
to open fire/to shoot a gun
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
